medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been in his usual state of health until 2 days before admission, when episodes of twitching of the head and neck began. The first episode occurred after he awoke in the morning, followed by a second episode 2 hours later, each lasting approximately 1 minute. A third episode occurred 4 hours after awakening, lasting 2 minutes and accompanied by stiffness of the left arm and leg. Observers reported loss of consciousness and full-body shaking.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of cholecystectomy 4 years prior, history of myopia and ectopia lentis with downward lens dislocation diagnosed 3 years before admission, attention deficitâ€“hyperactivity disorder, and developmental delays as a child.
medical_history.family_history: Mother reported hypercholesterolemia; maternal grandmother had dementia and seizures; paternal grandfather died after a stroke at age 70. No family history of clotting disorders, congenital heart disease, or sudden cardiac death.
medical_history.social_history: Patient is a college student, does not smoke tobacco, and does not use illicit drugs.
